Transformation: Vajra Nyoi |parent jutsu=Transformation Technique |jutsu classification=Ninjutsu |jutsu class type=Supplementary |users=Monkey King: Enma, Enra~anime |debut manga=120 |boruto=No |debut anime=71 |debut shippuden=No |boruto anime=No |game debut=Naruto: Ultimate Ninja 2 |movie debut=Road to Ninja: Naruto the Movie |jutsu media=Anime, Manga, Game, Movie }} The user [[transform]]s into a staff for their [[Summoning Technique|summoner]] to use as a weapon; [[Enma]]'s staff form was the preferred weapon of [[Hiruzen Sarutobi]], whose heavy use of it through decades of warfare contributed to his reputation as a "[[God of Shinobi]]". The staff is as hard as diamond, making it very destructive. This also renders it largely impervious to damage, making it useful as a defence; despite this, Enma still feels pain from clashing with the [[Sword of Kusanagi (Orochimaru)|Sword of Kusanagi]].''Naruto'' chapter 120 The staff is also able to extend to great lengths and/or width, enough that, in the anime, it could push the [[Nine-Tails]] beyond the borders of [[Konohagakure]].''Naruto: Shippūden'' episode 249 The user can produce any part of his regular body from the staff, such as his claws or fangs, to surprise opponents. Enma is shown to [[clone]] himself while in his staff form for use in the [[Adamantine Prison Wall]].[ == Trivia == * The folkloric [[Wikipedia:Sun Wukong|Sun Wukong]] had an extendable staff called [[Wikipedia:Ruyi Jingu Bang|Ruyi Jingu Bang]] (read in Japanese on'yomi as the "Nyoi Kinko Bō"). As in the story, Enma's transformation has golden-shaft ends. * A ''[[Wikipedia:Ruyi (scepter)|nyoi]]'', which can be translated as ''priest's staff'' but literally means ''as one wishes'', is a decorative object associated with Chinese Buddhist rituals. * {{translation|[[Wikipedia:Vajra|Vajra]]|金剛|Kongō}} is a weapon used as a ritual object to symbolise both the properties of a diamond (indestructibility) and a thunderbolt (irresistible force). In Japanese, the term is also synonymous with [[Wikipedia:adamant|adamantine]]. ** This also references Sun Wukong's staff, which had to be made heavy and durable in order for Wukong to be able to use it (due to other weapons being wielded by him ending up broken). == References == [[fr:Transformation - Bâton de la Vérité Bouddhique Indestructible]] [[pl:Henge: Kongōnyoi]]
